posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked:
A large part of group chats for me is organizing hangouts with my friends.

Often times though, people forget what date and time was decided on, or even forget that we’re hanging out completely.

It would be really nice to be able to organize events in group chats, and set dates and times for these events, so that my friends can glance at when these events are happening.

Additionally, being able to set reminders would also be really nice, maybe just a notification X time from the event, where X is customizable.

As the event date gets closer, a banner could show at the top of the group chat just as an additional prompt.

Facebook Messenger had a similar feature, but quite as fleshed out:

name-fb-messenger-reminder1200×1067 205 KB

What do you think?

Your request is related to this one here: Encrypted Calendar in Signal

I think Users want to have their calendar with all their events in one place. Which is outside of Signal. So adding “events” to Signal does not seem like a necessary thing for me to add.

There is, however, a need to agree on a date/event/movie etc., which could be solved by a survey function. (Currently a workaround is to use reactions for this)

posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked:
See, I think a calendar is too much. It’s needlessly complicated, and over the top in terms of what users actually need.

Being able to add an upcoming event or two, with a given date and time, location, and reminder, is more than enough for group chats.
But what would we gain then? I mean, I have to enter the event in my normal calendar outside of Signal anyway to prevent time collisions.

posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked: We gain reminders for those who don’t use personal calendars. Reminders that something’s been organized and finalized.
If people can not organize themselfs and forget appointments, it’s their fault. They should grow up and be responsible for their actions. Signal should not have to do childcare, in my opinion.

posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked: You could make that argument for any feature of Signal though. The point is to provide additional features that would be useful to group chats.

Jacob.Dean:

You could make that argument for any feature of Signal though.

I disagree. For example reactions, forwardings, group-calls etc. are all things that either match the DNA of a modern “Messenger” or are nothing that can be easily or privately done outside of Signal.

Jacob.Dean:

The point is to provide additional features

More Features does not equal a better application

Jacob.Dean:

that would be useful to group chats.

I doubt the usefulnes.

But I made my position clear. I’m gonna let other users post their opinions now

posts.name: Ponytail
posts.cooked:
I have mentioned about something similar in some other thread. I proposed an idea to schedule group calls.

Because group calls don’t ring, having an option to schedule group calls will be a plus.

And yes, as mentioned above, the feature request for having an encrypted calendar is quite similar to this feature request.

One could also add the feature to “pin” a message in a chat. Similar to Telegram.

In this message, there could be date/time/place etc.

ponytail:

Because group calls don’t ring

yet

ponytail:

similar

but not the same. I like this idea more because it is easier to implement: as an attachment. And it could simple send a notification like any other message

posts.name: Zack Ts
posts.cooked:
Use the group description for static group info.

You have 480 characters to go. :-)

You can use it even for decisions on stuff.

ZackTS:

Use the group description for static group info.

That would work, but has its limitations.

Especially because multiple reminders may not fit (like tasks or to-do stuff within a group) and Group Descriptions cannot notify
No one looks at group descriptions besides when they’re changed. I think the point is to remind friends that an event is coming up. A group description won’t do anything to help that.

posts.name: Zack Ts
posts.cooked:
Oh, whenever someone changes the description there is a message to the group to indicate that.

And: When you open the indicated message you can see the respective version of the text, i.e. older info-messages show older versions of the description text.

We use it to poll on appointment dates.

But you are right, for the reminders you need another solution.
Did you ever organize an event with a large number of people? There are always ppl that don’t get their own sh*t together

WhatsApp apparently working on a group chat events feature:

https://x.com/WABetaInfo/status/1712118156112589105

Personally I think this is a really useful idea.
For a number of my chats, the whole decision making process happens in the signal chat. Being able to then add an event to the chat would remind all relevant parties as the even approaches, regardless of calendars, having email addresses, sending invites, etc.

It also would seem to me that if WhatsApp are developing such a feature, there is probably enough interest to merit it.

It’s hard to convince people to switch to Signal when it has several key features less, even with the security argument which many don’t seem to care about.

The .ics file format is universal. There’s no need to reinvent the wheel. By all means use Signal to organize events, but actually creating an event should just result in opening a new entry in the associated calendar app. The .ics file could be shared with the entire group chat.

Hei, i’ve got an idea to improve the experience when organizing something with signal-groups:
People use (Signal)-groups to organize events where they meet and do something.

Right now every messenger i use supports groupdescriptions. These are commonly used to collect informations for every group-member. Typically this is text with dates, locations or people. For larger groups like at universities or sport-clubs there are also links to (google-)docs, calendars, cloud-folders, …

Signal could cleanup the groupdescription with adding the ability to save dates and locations as an extra field.
Somehow like that:

image11280×720 133 KB

For further features there could be a reminder (for e.g. important meetings in sport-clubs, student organisations) when opening the chat. That way every group-member can clearly see the important informations without scrolling through the last 100+ messages or looking through a salad of text and links in the group-description?

(Yes, everyone can save it to his/her private calendar, but an event published in a group is “more official”. I have this feature in RocketChat for upcoming meetings of the board of our sailing club, and that’s really practical.)
